<a id="CurveTexture"></a>

# CurveTexture

**Inherits:** [Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **\<** [Texture](Texture.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A 1D texture where pixel brightness corresponds to points on a curve.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A 1D texture where pixel brightness corresponds to points on a unit [Curve](Curve.md) resource, either in grayscale or in red. This visual representation simplifies the task of saving curves as image files.

If you need to store up to 3 curves within a single texture, use [CurveXYZTexture](CurveXYZTexture.md) instead. See also [GradientTexture1D](GradientTexture1D.md) and [GradientTexture2D](GradientTexture2D.md).

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_CurveTexture_TextureMode"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **TextureMode**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_CurveTexture_TextureMode)

<a id="CurveTexture_constant_TEXTURE_MODE_RGB"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TextureMode](CurveTexture.md#enum_CurveTexture_TextureMode) **TEXTURE_MODE_RGB** = `0`

Store the curve equally across the red, green and blue channels. This uses more video memory, but is more compatible with shaders that only read the green and blue values.<a id="CurveTexture_constant_TEXTURE_MODE_RED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TextureMode](CurveTexture.md#enum_CurveTexture_TextureMode) **TEXTURE_MODE_RED** = `1`

Store the curve only in the red channel. This saves video memory, but some custom shaders may not be able to work with this.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="CurveTexture_property_curve"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Curve](Curve.md) **curve** [ðŸ”—](#CurveTexture_property_curve)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_curve**\ (\ value\: [Curve](Curve.md)\ )
- [Curve](Curve.md) **get_curve**\ (\ )

The [Curve](Curve.md) that is rendered onto the texture. Should be a unit [Curve](Curve.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CurveTexture_property_texture_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[TextureMode](CurveTexture.md#enum_CurveTexture_TextureMode) **texture_mode** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#CurveTexture_property_texture_mode)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_texture_mode**\ (\ value\: [TextureMode](CurveTexture.md#enum_CurveTexture_TextureMode)\ )
- [TextureMode](CurveTexture.md#enum_CurveTexture_TextureMode) **get_texture_mode**\ (\ )

The format the texture should be generated with. When passing a CurveTexture as an input to a [Shader](Shader.md), this may need to be adjusted.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CurveTexture_property_width"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **width** = `256` [ðŸ”—](#CurveTexture_property_width)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_width**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_width**\ (\ )

The width of the texture (in pixels). Higher values make it possible to represent high-frequency data better (such as sudden direction changes), at the cost of increased generation time and memory usage.
